titleStmt.title: S. T. Wilson et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8704

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To,, the Honorable James F. Robertson Gov,, of Kentucky your Petitioners would respectfully represent unto,, your honor that at the June Term of the Green circuit court a fine of $50.00 was assessed against Charles, H, Blevins on a charge of carrying consealed deadly weapons, We would respectfully represent unto your honor that the carrying of the Pistol was on a day when several of them was a Rabbit hunting & Blevins carried the pistol for the purpose of shooting Rabbits & being sick about at the time the trial was had was unable to make defense and hence the fine was assessed. We in view of all the circumstances respectfully petition your honor to remit the fine as Blevins is a poor young man and it would considerably injure him to pay it.

S T. Wilson. circuit Clerk
J. D. Scott. Constable
J. C. Edwards
Wm Howell
L. Sanders
Wm E. Booker
Wm A. Elkin
Wm B. Allen Attorney
Y. O. Booker
A. W. Montgomery
J. C. Gumm
R, A, T, Vance
Samuel Nelson
John M. Meguyar
J, H, Skaggs
J, A, R, Mears
R. R. Sterman
G. W. Chaney
Robert D. Hite
W. J. Gaddie
W. S. Renfro
Lewis Johnson
Drewey Thompson
John Thompson
James E,, Edwards
J. R. Underwood
Wm Etherton
William B. Mears
John, Lee
Silas Y. Graham
J, D, Dobson
F, H Beams
H, Warren
H, T, Hagan, High sheriff
Charles Covum
Stphen Skaggs
Wm Peace
Elzay Warren
Joseph Dspain
Thomas F Fields
R. T. Sterman
Peter R. Bass
N, B. for further particulars inquire of D, P, Mears. Representative of Green Co Ky,,

Green Cir. Ct
Chs H. Blevins of Green Cty
Pettn to remit fine
$50. } Weapons
The fine in this case is remitted 17 Feby 1863
